intro: Parakeelya composita, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with erect, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow or orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parakeelya composita is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
